class openzwave.node.ZWaveNode(nodeId, network)¶

Represents a single Node within the Z-Wave Network

basic¶

The basic type of the node. :rtype: int

batteryLevel¶

The battery level of this node. Todo

capabilities¶

The capabilities of the node. :rtype: list()

commandClasses¶

The commandClasses of the node. :rtype: list()

generic¶

The generic type of the node. :rtype: int

groups¶

The groups of the node. :rtype: list()

hasCommandClass(commandClass)¶

Check that this node use this commandClass. Todo

isBeamingDevice¶

Is this node a beaming device. :rtype: bool

isBridgeController¶

Is this controller using the bridge controller library. :rtype: bool

isFrequentListeningDevice¶

Is this node a frequent listening device. :rtype: bool

isListeningDevice¶

Is this node a listening device. :rtype: bool

isLocked¶

Is this node locked. :rtype: bool

isOn¶

Is this node On. Todo

isPrimaryController¶

Is this node a primary controller of the network. :rtype: bool

isRoutingDevice¶

Is this node a routing device. :rtype: bool

isSecurityDevice¶

Is this node a security device. :rtype: bool

isSleeping¶

Is this node sleeping. :rtype: bool

isStaticUpdateController¶

Is this controller a static update controller (SUC). :rtype: bool

level¶

The level of the node. Todo

location¶

The location of the node. :rtype: str

manufacturerId¶

The manufacturer id of the node. :rtype: int

manufacturerName¶

The manufacturer name of the node. :rtype: str

name¶

The name of the node. :rtype: str

neighbors¶

The neighbors of the node. :rtype: list()

numGroups¶

Gets the number of association groups reported by this node. :rtype: list()

productId¶

The product Id of the node. :rtype: int

productName¶

The product name of the node. :rtype: str

productType¶

The product type of the node. :rtype: int

refreshInfo(node)¶

Request a refresh for node.

requestConfig()¶

Request config parameters for node.

security¶

The security type of the node. :rtype: int

signalStrength¶

The signal strenght of this node. Todo

specific¶

The specific type of the node. :rtype: int

values¶

The values of the node. :rtype: list()()

version¶

The version of the node. :rtype: int

class openzwave.controller.ZWaveController(network, controllerId=None, devicePath=None, userPath=None, configPath=None, options=None)¶

The driver objet. Hold options of the manager Also used to retrieve informations about the library, ...

capabilities¶

The capabilities of the controller. :rtype: list()

devicePath¶

The device path. :rtype: str

libraryConfigPath¶

The library Config path. :rtype: str

libraryDescription¶

The description of the library. :rtype: str

libraryTypeName¶

The name of the library. :rtype: str

libraryUserPath¶

The library User path. :rtype: str

libraryVersion¶

The version of the library. :rtype: str

node¶

The node controller on the network. :rtype: ZWaveNode

nodeId¶

The node Id of the controller on the network. :rtype: int

nodeName¶

The name of the controller on the network. :rtype: str

optionsManager¶

The options manager. :rtype: str

pythonLibraryVersion¶

The version of the python library. :rtype: str

class openzwave.scene.ZWaveScene(sceneId, network=None)¶

Represents a single scene within the Z-Wave Network

activate()¶

Activate the zwave scene.

addValue(valueid, valueData)¶

Add a value to the zwave scene.

create(name)¶

Create a new zwave scene and update the objectId field

label¶

The label of the scene.

setValue(valueid, valueData)¶

Set a value to the zwave scene.

values¶

The values used in the scene.

class openzwave.value.ZWaveValue(valueId, network=None, nodeId=None)¶

Represents a single value. Must be updated to use the cachedObject facilities.

asString¶

The value as String. :rtype: str

data¶

The data of the value. :rtype: depending of the type of the value

getValue(key)¶

The valueData of the value.

help¶

The help of the value. :rtype: str

label¶

The label of the value. :rtype: str

max¶

The max of the value. :rtype: int

min¶

The min of the value. :rtype: int

nodeId¶

The nodeId of the value.

units¶

The units of the value. :rtype: str

update(args)¶

Update node value from callback arguments.

class openzwave.network.ZWaveNetwork(networkId, devicePath='/dev/zwave', userPath='.', configPath=None, log=None, options='--logging true')¶

The network objet = homeid. It contains a reference to the manager

controller¶

The controller of the network. :rtype:

homeId¶

The homeId of the network. :rtype: int

manager¶

The manager of the network. :rtype:

nodes¶

The nodes of the network. :rtype: list()

nodesCount¶

The nodes count of the network. :rtype: int

sleepingNodesCount¶

The count of sleeping nodes on the network. :rtype: int

class openzwave.object.NullLoggingHandler(level=0)¶

A Null Logging Handler

Exception class for OpenZWave

class openzwave.object.ZwaveObject(objectId, network=None, useCache=True)¶

Represents a Zwave object. Values, nodes, ... can be changer by other managers on the network.

cacheProperty(prop)¶

Add this property to the cache manager.

homeId¶

The homeId of the node. :rtype: int

isOutdated(prop)¶

Check if property information is outdated.

lastUpdate¶

The last update date of the device.

objectId¶

The id of the object. objectId could be None, when creating a scene for example.

outdate(prop)¶

Says that the property information is outdated.

outdated¶

Are the informations of this object outdated.

How to manage the cache ?

2 ways of doing it : - refresh informations when setting the property - refresh informations when getting gtting property. Maybe whe could implement the 2 methods.

update(prop)¶

Says that the property are updated.

useCache¶

Should this object use cache from property

libopenzwave.PyNotifications = ['ValueAdded', 'ValueRemoved', 'ValueChanged', 'ValueRefreshed', 'Group', 'NodeNew', 'NodeAdded', 'NodeRemoved', 'NodeProtocolInfo', 'NodeNaming', 'NodeEvent', 'PollingDisabled', 'PollingEnabled', 'CreateButton', 'DeleteButton', 'ButtonOn', 'ButtonOff', 'DriverReady', 'DriverFailed', 'riverReset', 'MsgComplete', 'EssentialNodeQueriesComplete', 'NodeQueriesComplete', 'AwakeNodesQueried', 'AllNodesQueried', 'Error']¶

list() -> new empty list list(iterable) -> new list initialized from iterable’s items

list() -> new empty list list(iterable) -> new list initialized from iterable’s items
